result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Poblete was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with known felons, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay extradition costs in the sum of $400.00.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Per Judge Bastianelli, JOC to be amended per sentencing transcript page 16.  Total length of sentence - 7 years.  Initial term of confinement - 4 years w/credit for 229 days served.  Extended supervision - 3 years.  Sentence is concurrent to Illinois case 15CF939.  All other orders remain the same as imposed on 10/31/16.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney B Ekes.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 7 years WSP concurrent to IL 15CF939:  3 years initial confinement w/credit for 229 days served; 4 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP.  No contact w/known felons.  Pay $400 extradition costs.
**Note - Minutes are in error.  See 1/25/17 Notes.   kz

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Brett Ekes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 10/31/16 at 2:00.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: PT
Atty Ekes requests an adjournment for further discovery; no objection by the State.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Jury status hearing on 8/4/16 and jury trial on 8/8/16 are removed on the calendar.  Status conf. 7/19/16 at 9:00.  Bond continued.

Defendant Miguel A Poblete appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Det. Josh Zeller; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Rose. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.
